meanings.definition: Repeat or copy out (a group of words from a text or speech), typically with an indication that one is not the original author or speaker.
meanings.sent1: She liked to quote her favorite lines from books.
meanings.sent2: He would often quote famous speeches in his presentations.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to quote phrases from its owner.
meanings.sent4: His actions seemed to quote the words of his mentor.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to quote a passage from the textbook.

meanings.definition: A quotation from a text or speech.
meanings.sent1: The article included a quote from the CEO.
meanings.sent2: She framed her favorite quote and hung it on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The comedian delivered a funny quote during the show.
meanings.sent4: His tattoo featured a meaningful quote about life.
meanings.sent5: The graduation speech ended with an inspiring quote.
